result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. White

records.addlTxt:
2:24 PM Cases called: 22CF264, 22CF339, 22CF513, 22CF678, 22CF722, 22CF870 and 22CM173. Defendant Michael L. White in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Michael L. White.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing in 22CF870 & 22CF722. All other cases are riding along for today's purposes. 

Defendant would like to waive right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in each of the felony files. All of the Informations that will be filed, will either mirror the criminal complaint or mirror the agreement.  Defendant will file the Informations within 24 hours. The Defendant will have the following 24 hours to object to the filings.

There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  
Defendant enters a no contest plea to the following counts:
Count 1 in 22CF264: Felony Retail Theft
Count 1 in 22CF339: Retail Theft
Count 4 in 22CF513: Retail Theft 
Count 1 in 22CF678: Bail Jumping Felony
Count 7 in 22CF678: Felony Retail Theft

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 3 years Probation sentence withheld on each count concurrent. 

Conditions of Probation:
Restitution to be determined within 30 days. Defendant to make monthly payments of at least $100 until restitution is paid in full. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. To be completed within 6 months of plea date.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/controlled substances.
No contact with Kwik Trip locations, Festival Food locations, Woodmans locations, Target locations, Best Buy locations or Ace Hardware locations.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
5 sets of court costs and surcharges. 

Parties will file a stipulation with the court as to jail credit. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in, Including all of 22CF722, 22CF870 and 22CM173.

11:34am Cases called: 22CF339, 22CF722, 22CM173, 22CF678, 22CF513, 22CF870 & 22CF264. Defendant Michael L. White appeared by video, in custody from the Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Erika Amundson appeared by video for Michael L. White. Attorney Monica Fallon appeared for the State of Wisconsin 

22CF870 & 22CF722: Waives reading of the complaints. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived enough to accommodate counsel schedule. 

All cases scheduled for 08/30/22 at 2:30pm. Preliminary Hearing in 22CF870 & 22CF722.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:34 AM Cases called: 22CF264, 22CF339, 22CF513, 22CF678, 22CF722, 22CF870 & 22CM173. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael L. White appeared by video, in custody from the Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Erika Amundson appeared by video for Michael L. White. Warrants are executed.

22CF722 and 22CF870: Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaints in these cases. 

State requests one $2,500 cash bond be set to cover all cases. Court orders $2,500 cash bond as requested. 

All cases to come into intake on 08/19/22 to allow time for complaints, on the new cases, to be provided to defendant for review.

Conditions:
No contact with Kwik Trip any location, Woodmans, Festival any location, Target any location, Best Buy, ACE Hardware.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
No contact with M.P.
(Covers 22CF722, 22CF870, 22CF264, 22CF678, 22CF339, 22CF513, 22CM173)
Return on warrant on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 11:16 AM: 22CF678. 22CF513, 22CF870, 22CF264, 22CM173, 22CF722, 22CF339.
Defendant Michael L. White not in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Michael L. White.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants ordered in all cases but 22CF722 (which already has a currently active warrant).

11:18 AM cases 22CF870, 22CF264, 22CF339, 22CF513, 22CF678, 22CF722, 22CM173 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael L. White appeared by video.  Attorney Erika Amundson appeared by video for Michael L. White. Court advises defendant must appear in person tomorrow or a warrant will be ordered. 
A hearing is scheduled for 8/11/22 at 11:00 AM.

9:53 AM cases 22CF513, 22CF264, 22CM173, 22CF678,22CF339, 22CF870, 22CF722 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael L. White not in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Michael L. White. Attorney Amundson has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance.

Defendant was given order in date of 08/10/2022 at 11:00 AM in 22CF870. All cases rescheduled to this date and time.

Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
